Function for setting the initial values from priors for simulation

Source: R/priors.R
get_priors_from_init.Rd

Function for setting the initial values from priors for simulation

Usage

get_priors_from_init(
  priors,
  num_strata,
  num_delays,
  num_steps,
  autoregresive,
  moving_average
)

Arguments

priors

A list of all of the nowcast priors. You can use set_priors() to change the priors of the function (see details)

num_strata

Integer. Number of strata for the population. Default is 2.

num_delays

Integer. Number of delay strata. Default is 8.

num_steps

Integer. Number of time steps to simulate. Default is 10.

autoregresive

An AR() object with the autoregresive components for the epidemic and delay processes.

moving_average

A MA() object with the moving average component for the epidemic and delay processes.

Value

An init function that generates initial values based upon the priors to send to any rstan sampling or optimization algorithm.

On this page

Developed by Rodrigo Zepeda-Tello, Rami Yaari, Matteo Perini, Columbia University in the City of New York.
